intro: Celmisia neozelandica, commonly known as the New Zealand bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, often in rocky or gravelly soils. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Celmisia neozelandica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
